summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff regarding logistics for picking up a signed 6(e) order from Judge Alison Nathan's chambers in the Epstein case. The emails discuss whether the order needed to go to Part 1 and note a prior order was from a district judge.

persons.name: McEnany
persons.context: Sent the initial email on January 31, 2020, notifying colleagues that Judge Nathan's clerk called to say the Epstein 6(e) order was signed and ready for pickup from her chambers.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Her clerk called to notify that she signed the Epstein 6(e) order, and it is ready to be picked up from her chambers.

connections.description: McEnany is communicating about an order signed by Judge Nathan and coordinating its pickup from her chambers.

events.title: Epstein 6(e) Order Signed by Judge Nathan
events.description: Judge Alison Nathan signed a 6(e) order in the Epstein case, and her clerk notified the U.S. Attorney's Office that it was ready for pickup from her chambers.

keyFacts: A 6(e) order in the Epstein case was signed by Judge Alison Nathan and ready for pickup from her chambers as of January 31, 2020.
There was internal discussion among USANYS staff about whether the order needed to go to 'Part 1' and if a magistrate court order was sufficient, noting a prior order was from a district judge.
The email chain shows logistical coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding obtaining the signed court order.
